newsitem.title: USA: Raytheon wins $11.5 million army contract.
newsitem.headline: Raytheon wins $11.5 million army contract.

text.p: Raytheon Co's Electronic Systems unit said Wednesday it had won a $11.5 million contract to build satellite communications equipment for the U.S. army.
The company said it would build four prototype terminals to allow communication via commercial and military satellites.
It said the contract would be open to the possibility of the army ordering three to five more terminals next year for another $6 million.

The company, which specializes in high technology, said the contract could eventually be worth more than $157 million if the army decides to order more than 200 additional terminals with spare parts and technical training.

It said the terminals, known as Tri-Band Super High Frequency Tactical Terminals for HMMWV Variant, are designed to be mounted on vehicles to ensure communication in battle or other dangerous situations.
